original:
The Academy of Painting, established under the direction of Ciccarelli, marked a significant attempt to unify and create a distinctive national style in Chilean art, primarily promoting a neoclassical aesthetic. In Europe, art academies emphasized uniformity by instituting fixed and rigorous guidelines to ensure that "true art" adhered to a defined path. Chilean academies sought to adopt this model, drawing on French methodologies.

Ini
